Package deco2800.thomas.managers

Class NetworkManager

java.lang.Object
deco2800.thomas.managers.AbstractManager
deco2800.thomas.managers.TickableManager
deco2800.thomas.managers.NetworkManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tickable
public class NetworkManager
extends TickableManager
NetworkManager Handles both server and client side of the networking stack.

  • Method Details

    • incrementMessagesReceived

      public void incrementMessagesReceived()
      Increments the number of messages received.

      Used be the client and server listeners to update the number of messages received by this particular NetworkManager.

    • addClientConnection

      public void addClientConnection​(java.lang.Integer connectionID, java.lang.String username)
      Add a user connection to the list of connections
      Parameters:
      connectionID - - the id of the connected user
      username - - the username of the connected user

    • removeClientConnection

      public void removeClientConnection​(java.lang.Integer connectionID, java.lang.String username)
      Deletes a mapping between the given client and user.

      Once a client disconnects from the server (for whatever reason), if they had a user then it will be deleted.

      Parameters:
      connectionID - The connectionID of the client to be removed.
      username - The username of the client to be removed.

    • getClientUsernameFromConnection

      public java.lang.String getClientUsernameFromConnection​(int connectionID)
      Retrieves a username mapped to a particular connection ID.
      Parameters:
      connectionID - The connection ID of the client to retrieve the username of.
      Returns:
      the username mapped to the given connection ID, or null if it doesn't exist.

      the number of messages sent

    • isHost

      public boolean isHost()
      Is this user the host?
      Returns:
      true if hosting, false otherwise

      public boolean connectToHost​(java.lang.String ip, java.lang.String username)
      Connects to a host at specified ip and port
      Parameters:
      ip - - the ip of the host
      username - - the username to connect with
      Returns:
      boolean - Was the connection successful?

    • deleteEntity

      public void deleteEntity​(AbstractEntity e)
      Delete the given entity.

      The host will ensure the entity has also been deleted in its own game. Client deletion of entities is handled in the EntityDeleteMessage class, which will be sent by the server once it receives the EntityDeleteMessage from the client.

      Parameters:
      e - - the entity to delete
